item.title: When to Expect Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag Remake's Reveal
item.description:
If the Assassins and Templars got along as well as the Assassin's Creed franchise and leaks, then there would be no Assassin-Templar war. The remake of Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag is currently Ubisoft's worst-kept secret. Indeed, all manner of leaks, reports, official teases, and actor remarks have made the existence of Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag Remake all but completely confirmed. That, of course, leads to the logical follow-up question of when Ubisoft will give the game a proper reveal.

Last year, Insider Gaming reported that Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag 's remake was intended to release around November 2025. However, this was possibly delayed due to the AC Shadow s delay that happened prior to its release. It was reported that this delay would impact the rest of the roadmap, which would imminently mean Assassin's Creed Jade and Assassin's Creed Invictus (both codenames) would also be impacted. Still, if its original intent was to release in late 2025, that could possibly still happen. Otherwise, sometime in 2026 sounds likely. With this release window in mind, it becomes easier to track down when to expect its proper reveal.

Assassin's Creed Shadows was delayed from a November 2025 release to February 2025 then ultimately to March 2025. It's possible this four-month delay would have a similar impact on Black Flag's remake. However, it's also possible that resources were shuffled around, which delayed the remake further.

Gamescom 2025

Ubisoft is confirmed to attend Gamescom 2025, which means fans can expect at least one trailer during the showcase. It'll be showing off Anno 117: Pax Romana in all likelihood, but anything beyond that is guesswork. However, if Black Flag still drops this year, then Gamescom would be the best opportunity to show it off on the world stage. It would no doubt generate a lot of excitement at the event because of its enduring popularity, and it would be a great power move for the game since there is no Ubisoft Forward event this year. Ubisoft could announce a September event, in theory, but that seems unlikely given these most happen in the summer.

Gamescom is the perfect stage to debut a trailer focused on the AC4: Black Flag Remake 's gameplay. If not Gamescom, then there's only one other stage confirmed for this year befitting the hype of the remake.

While a title like Black Flag deserves a proper showcase, it wouldn't be unheard of for Ubisoft to announce it on a random Tuesday.

The Game Awards 2025

If not Gamescom, then The Game Awards is the next logical location for the reveal. This would certainly mean the internal delay pushed the Black Flag remake into 2026, and even if it were further into 2026 than most would like, TGA is a good way to end the year on a strong note.

Of course, it's hard to say for sure. It's possible that Ubisoft doesn't intend to showcase the game at all this year. That would only mean a longer period of continuous AC4: Black Flag rumors and leaks, which is a bit of a double-edged sword. On the one hand, it's a good thing because there is clear fan demand for it. On the other hand, fans will eventually get tired of rumors and leaks through no direct fault of Ubisoft itself.

Ubisoft Forward 2026

If fans don't see Edward Kenway rear his head this year, then that means a later 2026 date than most would have hoped. If it were to be announced early next year, then it would have to be a surprise announcement, if not the earliest Ubisoft Forward in the company's history. The stronger likelihood is that Black Flag would top Ubisoft Forward in summer 2026, meaning fans still have several months ahead of waiting.

Ultimately, barring any surprises, these three events simply make the most sense. I would bet on them in that order—Gamescom, TGA 2025, or Ubisoft event—but many fans would no doubt welcome an earlier surprise.

item.title: Roblox Players Are Boycotting The Hatch
item.description:
Roblox ’s current event, The Hatch, is being boycotted by several players amid child safety concerns, and the platform’s inclusion of a controversial creator in the Easter egg hunt. Roblox is an online gaming platform and game creation system founded by David Baszucki and Erik Cassel in 2004. Players gained access to the platform in 2006, where users could indulge in free-to-play games fueled by in-game purchases and create games too, for other users to experience.

Despite Roblox raking in an average of 85.3 million daily active users as of February 2025, the platform has suffered its share of controversies over the years. The Roblox devs added a new rule to the terms and conditions recently, which caused some concern in the community regarding usernames. Considering how large-scale the gaming platform is, and the number of users of all ages populating it, it’s been a constant endeavor to try and strike the right balance, but some creators are spoiling it for all with unsuitable content.

Roblox players flocked to social media to encourage the community to boycott The Hatch event, mainly because the team allowed a controversial creator to take part in the hunt when they are known for subjecting children to mature topics. The Hatch event offers players the chance to collect, trade, and merge hundreds of Easter eggs that can be discovered in a slew of games, including some of the best Squid Game Roblox games in the catalog. While the event is designed to be a widespread bit of fun for everyone to take part in, several players were disappointed in Roblox ’s disregard for keeping the hunt safe for children.

Roblox Players Boycott The Hatch Over Child Safety Concerns

Other boycotting comments accused Roblox of simply wanting money over taking precautions, and one Roblox user noted that they’ve never been so disappointed in the dev team before. Roblox ’s history of banning and then inexplicably unbanning the problematic creator has created another point of contention. The platform’s ethics were also targeted last year, when the Roblox team addressed “child labor” accusations, and these allegations tend to detract from the online game’s child-friendly image.

Roblox has taken extra measures to safeguard the gaming platform for children over the years, noting that the system is a lot safer than other platforms regarding mature content. In response to the controversy, Roblox ’s CEO encouraged parents to keep their kids away from the platform if they feel uncomfortable with the content, and highlighted the game’s parental controls that restrict certain content from children and monitor their screen time.

item.title: Roblox: Project Smash Codes (July 2025)
item.description:
Project Smash is a simple but very fun Roblox game that has deservedly become extremely popular in less than one year. When you first start this experience, it is not very clear what is going on, but the high quality of the game is immediately apparent, starting with the interface and ending with the combat system.

When you get into the game, all you have to do is choose one of several free classes and just start playing. Then, you get to a huge map where a bunch of players are fighting to the limit of their abilities so as not to lose all their health or fly off the map. There is a huge selection of characters in the game, each with 4 unique abilities, but most of them are expensive, so you have to defeat many players to get them. Therefore, it would be a good idea to redeem some Project Smash codes to get free currency.

Updated July 4, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: If you're looking for some extra cash in Project Smash , three active codes can help you out with that. Each code provides 1,500 Cash, which will be beneficial for both avid players and beginners. It is worth noting that the codes might expire, so make sure to use them on time. On top of that, bookmark this article, as new codes might appear soon enough.

All Project Smash Codes

Working Project Smash Codes

  • Princess - Redeem for 1.5k Cash.
  • wellworks - Redeem for 1.5k Cash.
  • sketch - Redeem for 1.5k Cash.

Expired Project Smash Codes

  • anniversary

There are over 20 different characters in Project Smash , and this list is only growing with updates. This diversity adds a lot of interesting situations to the game and forces players to adapt and learn. However, new players will have to spend many hours in the game or buy Robux to try out all the characters.

How to Redeem Codes in Project Smash

In Project Smash , as in many Roblox games, redeeming codes is a fairly simple task even for beginners. However, this game has a well-designed interface that, although beautiful and convenient, may be unfamiliar to many. To help confused players, we have created a guide explaining how to redeem codes in Project Smash .

  • Open Roblox and launch Project Smash .
  • Pay attention to the left side of the screen. Click on the rectangular button with three dashes.
  • Paste the code from the list of working codes into the dark purple field and click Redeem.

Remember that codes expire quickly, so in order not to miss out on rewards, redeem them as soon as you can.

How to Get More Project Smash Codes

We regularly update articles with Roblox codes, so we recommend that you bookmark this guide in your browser. It's also a good idea to follow the social media of the Project Smash developers:

  • Project Smash Roblox group
  • Project Smash Discord server
  • Project Smash X page

item.title: Marvel Rivals' Venom and Jean Grey Connection is Surprisingly Touching
item.description:
It's been an exciting few weeks for the Marvel Rivals community. As Season 2.5 began to wrap up, fans set their sights on what could be coming in Marvel Rivals Season 3. An onslaught of leaks soon hit the internet, claiming that Blade and Jean Grey were being added as playable heroes in Marvel Rivals ' next season, and that the season's story would revolve around Knull, the god of the Symbiotes. Those rumors turned out to be true.

Marvel Rivals Season 3: The Abyss Awakens has been officially confirmed, and its launch date is set for July 11. With a week still to go before release, developer NetEase has begun its gradual unveiling of the upcoming season's content, including Marvel Rivals ' new wave of Battle Pass skins, a new map, and the full reveal of Season 3's introductory message, which forges a sincere connection between two unlikely heroes.

Marvel Rivals' Heartfelt Jean Grey and Venom Connection Explained

When booting up a new season of Marvel Rivals for the first time, players are presented with a long text message from developer NetEase. This message introduces the new season's narrative themes, highlights the season's most important characters, and usually gives a little bit of insight into the development process. NetEase has just released Marvel Rivals Season 3's introductory message.

An even lengthier message than normal, Season 3's introduction talks about NetEase's desire to adapt Knull, but not knowing which hero would be best suited to take him down. NetEase's partners at Marvel suggested that Jean Grey and the Phoenix Force could pave the way for some interesting stories, with the hero's light being the thing to unite heroes against Knull's forces of darkness. This concept apparently electrified the team, but during development, they realized that it isn't "just a 'Symbiote Season' or a 'Phoenix Season.' It's something more."

What follows is a lengthy section dedicated to the relationship between Eddie Brock and the Venom Symbiote. NetEase says "they've long surpassed friendship or family, even the most intimate words don't describe the bond they share," and that "through cycles of hurt and healing, of parting and reunion, they rediscovered their humanity and transformed...into a hero, a protector."

This is a really lovely summary of Venom's character arc of the last few decades, but what makes it even sweeter is the next part of NetEase's message, which forms a connection between Venom/Eddie Brock and Phoenix/Jean Grey, who "share a bond just as deep and complex." It's said that from the Phoenix, "Jean learned to be bold," and from Jean, "the Phoenix learned restraint." Marvel Rivals ' version of Jean is one that's reached a "perfect union" with the Phoenix Force.

In most mainstream depictions of the Phoenix Force – and most depictions of Venom before the 2018 movie – these human-alien relationships are usually portrayed as more parasitic than symbiotic. The Phoenix Force corrupts Jean Grey and turns her against her friends, while the Venom Symbiote heightens Eddie Brock's anger and hatred. It's really nice to see Marvel Rivals turn the tables and show how these relationships have actually strengthened its versions of these heroes.

Marvel Rivals' Season Intros Continue to be a Strength

Though long passages of text aren't everybody's cup of tea – especially when they appear on the start-up screen every time the game loads – Marvel Rivals ' season introductions are usually surprisingly earnest. NetEase will often take the themes and heroes of the new season and link them to the development team's journey in a genuine way. Season 1, for instance, introduced The Fantastic Four to Marvel Rivals , and NetEase's introductory message talked about the family it had forged in the studio while working on the hero shooter.

Most players will probably skip straight past these messages every season, but it's nice to see a developer be so candid about its experiences working with such a beloved IP.

item.title: Roblox: Motorcycle Racing Codes (July 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Motorcycle Racing Codes
  • How to Redeem Motorcycle Racing Codes
  • How to Get More Motorcycle Racing Codes

If you like racing and bikes, then Motorcycle Racing is just what you need. The game offers a classic and well-developed motorcycle racing simulator. But unlike real life, you can train and earn Energy that will increase your speed during the race. So, to speed up this process, you can use Motorcycle Racing codes.

As expected from Roblox codes, they contain valuable items, such as Potions and even Mythic Eggs. The latter are especially valuable, since you can hatch the rarest pets from them.

Updated July 4, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Motorcycle Racing currently has only one working code that gives various useful bonuses. Keep in mind that you should redeem this code as soon as possible since it is likely to expire soon enough. You can also check this article periodically, as we update it with new codes regularly.

All Motorcycle Racing Codes

Working Motorcycle Racing Codes

  • Update7 - Redeem this code to get free rewards (NEW)

Expired Motorcycle Racing Codes

  • Update6
  • Update1
  • sorry
  • Release

The gameplay of Motorcycle Racing is no different from other training simulators on the platform. First, you need to train to accumulate Energy. Then take part in races for Wins. Next, you buy pets for multipliers and repeat all the steps. Players can also rebirth for permanent bonuses. Moreover, by buying new bikes and trainers, you will significantly speed up your progress both during tournaments and during races. But it is worth noting that in the early stages, your progress will be slow, especially earning wins. So, to fix this, players should redeem Motorcycle Racing codes.

Even though the codes expire after a while after the release, they will bring you many useful rewards. For this reason, we recommend that you redeem Motorcycle Racing codes as soon as possible.

How to Redeem Motorcycle Racing Codes

The code redemption option in Motorcycle Racing works no different than in other Roblox games. You can get free goodies from the developers in the first minutes of the game. And for convenience, players can follow these steps:

  • Launch the Motorcycle Racing experience.
  • Next, open the Shop and scroll to the very bottom.
  • Enter the code in the appropriate field.
  • After that, click the Redeem button to get free rewards.

How to Get More Motorcycle Racing Codes

To avoid missing new Motorcycle Racing codes, you should bookmark this article. Like our other Roblox codes article, we will update it over time. In addition, you should visit the official community pages of the game, where you will find news and codes first-hand:

  • Official Funny Games Discord server
  • Official Manotoun X page
  • Official Funny Simulаtors Roblox group
